Module com.example.miniproyecto4
Package com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Game

Interface IGameManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
GameManager
public interface IGameManager
Interface defining the contract for game management operations in Battleship. Provides methods for game lifecycle, turn management, shot processing, and game state persistence.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • startNewGame

      void startNewGame(String playerNickname)
      Starts a new game with the specified player nickname. Initializes both players, places ships, and sets up initial game state.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - the nickname for the human player

    • loadGame

      void loadGame()
      Loads a previously saved game from persistent storage. Restores players, game status, and turn information.

    • processPlayerShot

      ShotResult processPlayerShot(Coordinate coordinate)
      Processes a shot from the human player at the specified coordinate.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the target coordinate for the shot
      Returns:
      the result of the shot (INVALID, WATER, HIT, or SUNK)

    • processComputerShot

      ShotResult processComputerShot()
      Processes a shot from the computer player. Uses AI strategy to select a target and processes the shot.
      Returns:
      the result of the shot (INVALID, WATER, HIT, or SUNK)

    • getHumanPlayer

      IPlayer getHumanPlayer()
      Returns the human player instance.
      Returns:
      the human player

    • getComputerPlayer

      IPlayer getComputerPlayer()
      Returns the computer player instance.
      Returns:
      the computer player

    • getGameStatus

      GameStatus getGameStatus()
      Returns the current game status.
      Returns:
      the current game status

    • isPlayerTurn

      boolean isPlayerTurn()
      Checks if it is currently the human player's turn.
      Returns:
      true if it is the player's turn, false otherwise

    • switchTurn

      void switchTurn()
      Switches the turn between the human player and computer player.

    • saveGame

      void saveGame()
      Saves the current game state to persistent storage.

    • hasWinner

      boolean hasWinner()
      Checks if the game has a winner.
      Returns:
      true if either player or computer has won, false otherwise

    • getWinner

      IPlayer getWinner()
      Returns the winner of the game.
      Returns:
      the winning player, or null if there is no winner yet

    • resetGame

      void resetGame()
      Resets the game to its initial state. Clears both player boards and reinitializes game settings.

    • getLastComputerShot

      Coordinate getLastComputerShot()
      Returns the last coordinate where the computer player took a shot.
      Returns:
      the last computer shot coordinate
